summary: I have a stomachache so I'm watching Travis Willingham's Yeehaw Game Ranch as a nice mindless form of entertainment (also, so...
body:
I have a stomachache so I’m watching Travis Willingham’s Yeehaw Game Ranch as a nice mindless form of entertainment (also, so that I understand the tetanus Terry jokes) and thus far:

Travis has (in-game) punched a horse

His character is allegedly the son of a walrus

The decor reminds me of when a bunch of friends and I rented a cabin in rural Wisconsin for a weekend

There are cheetos in a martini glass

Which is also on brand for the Wisconsin cabin rental tbh

There is an unnamed armadillo of indeterminate gender and a second armadillo whose presence hasn’t been acknowledged

I live blog Critical Role every week.

summary:
Caleb: "You could have died."
Beau: "I wasn't hurt that badly. Caduceus said all my bleeding was internal. That's where the...
body:
Caleb: “You could have died.”

Beau: “I wasn’t hurt that badly. Caduceus said all my bleeding was internal. That’s where the blood’s supposed to be!”

body:
Is it Thursday yet?

¯\_(ツ)_/¯ I don’t think so

(I’m so close to finishing Campaign 1. How does Matt come up with this stuff, seriously? I am in awe)

blog.name: kimabutch
blog.title: Revolutionary
blog.description: I'm Charlie! I'm attempting to tag "cr spoilers" until the subsequent Tuesday, but don't expect perfection. I'm into a lot of things — right now it's mostly Critical Role, but Utena still owns my heart. 22, butch lesbian, she/her. Link to asks!

summary: (Sorry i might have sent one before i think) more song stuff, i feel Ares by Winters Island is fitting for percy, & either BRN...
question: (Sorry i might have sent one before i think) more song stuff, i feel Ares by Winters Island is fitting for percy, & either BRN or Blame It On The Kids by AViVA for the soltrice academy trio
answer:
You sent in Ares, but no worries!

BRN is absolutely terrifying for the Soltryce Days:

“Set me on fire/ 
Watch them conspire/ 
I will defy ya/ 
I’ll set them on fire”

But the idea of the trio subjecting themselves to pain to gain power is, well, fitting. This has a similar theme:

“It seems I’m losing myself like a victim/ 
But I’ll never let myself lose position/ 
I want to work you deep into my system“ 

Blame It on the Kids is also pretty disturbing for them being kept within Trent’s control, and Caleb taking full responsibility for his actions: 

“Never gon’ get away, never gon’ get away/ 
Never gon’ break their chains/ 
Watching me patiently, watching me patiently/ 
Watching me take the blame” 

Come yell at me about songs that remind you of Critical Role! (Playlist | song masterlist & spreadsheet by disasterhumans | CR music tag)

summary: so, I just heard Elijah by Matthew and the Atlas, and... it's such a good song for Vax?? it's really sad, but very fitting, and...
question: so, I just heard Elijah by Matthew and the Atlas, and... it's such a good song for Vax?? it's really sad, but very fitting, and I think it probably deserves a spot on the playlist.
answer:
Oh fuck this is SO fitting. This is just such a poetic way of putting Vax’s burden from the Raven Queen — how hard following her is, beyond even his own fear of his death:

“Broken by the back of it/ 
It was hard enough without the loss/ 
Hanging on a thread of it/ 
It was hard enough without the cost” 

The line about thread works so well with the threads of fate, and then the cross imagery in the chorus:

“Elijah, you’re too young to be lost/ 
Elijah, don’t fade out on the cross”

Is fitting for Vax as a sort of martyr. And then, oh Keyleth…

“Dancing to your lover’s beat/ 
Beating on heavy feet/
Working on a dream you made
Well, you made enough to ride the wave”

Come yell at me about songs that remind you of Critical Role! (Playlist | song masterlist & spreadsheet by disasterhumans | CR music tag)

blog.description: I'm Charlie! I'm attempting to tag "cr spoilers" until the subsequent Tuesday, but don't expect perfection. I'm into a lot of things — right now it's mostly Critical Role, but Utena still owns my heart. 22, butch lesbian, she/her. Link to asks!

summary: Continuing the fandom's apparent mission to get Hozier's entire discography onto this playlist: I think Nobody is a great one...
question: Continuing the fandom's apparent mission to get Hozier's entire discography onto this playlist: I think Nobody is a great one for Kima/Allura, and As It Was makes me think of Molly, either when he died as Lucien and came back, or an AU where he digs himself up a second time and goes back to the Nein.
answer:
I support this mission :D and also Kimallura songs!! Especially songs about wandering the world and still coming back to thoughts of your woman:

“And I’ve done everythin’ and I’ve been everywhere, you know […]/ 
Still I’ve had no love like your love from nobody”

I also feel like Kima brings out the cheekiness in Allura:

“I’d be appalled if I saw you ever try to be a saint/ 
I wouldn’t fall for someone I thought couldn’t misbehave” 

As It Was is painful, particularly the opening line, “There is a roadway, muddy and foxgloved.” 

I feel like these lines particularly are good for Molly returning from the dead:

“And tell me if somehow some of it remained/ 
How long you would wait for me?/ 
How long I’d been away?“ 

Ouch.

Come yell at me about songs that remind you of Critical Role! (Playlist | song masterlist & spreadsheet by disasterhumans | CR music tag)

tags: my running hc that’s not super canon is that yasha was human and was brought back essentially from death by the stormlord
i bet aasimar dreams are wild
summary: i really like the vibe that taliesin introduces to the group with caduceus like it puts the nein in this really morbid,...
body:
i really like the vibe that taliesin introduces to the group with caduceus like it puts the nein in this really morbid, fascinating retrospective light

much as the tea thing is a coincidence, he and molly have this really tangible link, and sam talks about jester not doing a whole lot of cleric-ing by herself, but caduceus is really clearly distinct from them in a way molly wasn’t

there’s this really strong throughline of death and rebirth in the entire party— everyone has had to abandon just about every aspect of their old lives, and it wouldn’t be a stretch to say molly, fjord, yasha, and nott have already died once and walk around like resurrected but altered beings in the ash of who they were. molly had the closest tie to death: he started life in his own grave and his power came from bringing himself a little closer to death in every fight, so in retrospect it seems incredibly inevitable that he would essentially be called back first

and the one to basically nurse them back to a functioning state is caduceus, a death-focused cleric they meet in a graveyard in the middle of a cursed and dying forest, who makes living things grow from the dead and literally has his own personal decay cantrip. he’s spent his entire life facilitating rebirth and he joins a party of people who have either already died once or who try to reverse death (or, y’know, can punch ghosts)

caduceus feels like a shepherd or ferryman across the styx for all these lost souls given to them in exchange for the one of their own closest to death and even as a party member he has this weird omniscience to him. divine beings get described as beautiful in an alien sort of way which really describes caduceus also— with him following the wildmother he almost comes across as some kind of heaven-sent being/angel of death who’s so fascinated by the earth and how beautiful it is that he wants to stay.

he just makes me think of the adventure time dynamic between marceline and pb where she’s happy that marceline makes the choice to eventually die and be at rest someday, and tells her really gently “i’ll be the one to put you in the ground”. not an amazing comparison, but i absolutely adore caduceus and i can’t stop thinking about it (and i really want him to have tea with the raven queen)

and the one to basically nurse them back to a functioning state is caduceus, a death-focused cleric they meet in a graveyard in the middle of a cursed and dying forest, who makes living things grow from the dead and literally has his own personal decay cantrip. he’s spent his entire life facilitating rebirth and he joins a party of people who have either already died once or who try to reverse death (or, y’know, can punch ghosts)

caduceus feels like a shepherd or ferryman across the styx for all these lost souls given to them in exchange for the one of their own closest to death and even as a party member he has this weird omniscience to him. divine beings get described as beautiful in an alien sort of way which really describes caduceus also— with him following the wildmother he almost comes across as some kind of heaven-sent being/angel of death who’s so fascinated by the earth and how beautiful it is that he wants to stay.

he just makes me think of the adventure time dynamic between marceline and pb where she’s happy that marceline makes the choice to eventually die and be at rest someday, and tells her really gently “i’ll be the one to put you in the ground”. not an amazing comparison, but i absolutely adore caduceus and i can’t stop thinking about it (and i really want him to have tea with the raven queen)

tags: have a lot of Thoughts & Feelings about the brjeaus
title: Excerpt on healing, coping
body:
“Just checking up on ya. Making sure you’re…” Fjord shrugged. “Well, you don’t have to be okay.”

“I am, though.”

“Sure,” he said, giving her a wary look. He slid down to a sitting position next to Beau, legs stretched out, parallel to hers. “Wanna talk about it, then?”

“I’m an adult, Fjord. We’re both adults.” Beau huffed a laugh, leaned back harder against the wall. “What’s the point in trying to make sense of old, meaningless bullshit?”

“But, like, I dunno…” Fjord stared at the space above Beau’s head. “Have you ever actually just taken the time to cry about it? You know, let loose, feel shitty, vent and break some things?”

“I spent almost a decade of my life letting loose and breaking things, man.” She leveled a blank look at him. “Thought the group wasn’t a fan of all those random bar fights I liked to get into.”

“Yeah, but. What about grieving? You know, what about venting, actually talking about it, and letting yourself just be upset for what they took from you? What they did to you?”

“Is this about me, or is this about you, Fjord?” She glared, brittle-sharp. “Did you let yourself grieve for what those kids from your childhood did to you? For the way your parents abandoned you? Have you cried or vented about how all those fuckers made you hate yourself so much you tried to yank out your own damn teeth?”

Fjord didn’t flinch, but he did move away a little, cast his gaze to the side. Silent, for once.

Beau dropped her gaze, too, guilt already seeping in. She always ended up hurting exactly the wrong people, didn’t she? She was trying so hard, but she still couldn’t change, couldn’t be better than the piece of shit she was.

Deep breaths. Try again.

“Sorry,” she muttered eventually, scrubbing at her cheek. “That was fucking uncalled for.”

“Nah,” said Fjord, elbowing her gently. She looked up at him, surprised. “I’d say that was, uh, pretty called for, actually. Should’ve known you’d go for the throat.”

“I shouldn’t have, though. I’m sorry.”

“Yeah, well. I’m sorry, too.” His lips twitched. “I’m the last person who should be pushing you on this, turns out.”

Beau managed a hoarse laugh. She dropped her head on Fjord’s shoulder, steady, solid. “We’re pretty fucked up, aren’t we?” she muttered.

“Eh, maybe.” He wrapped an arm around her. “But misery loves company, right?”

“You know what, though?” Beau exhaled, relaxing. “I’m not miserable, actually. I’m really not.”

“Yeah.” Fjord hummed, bumped his chin against the top of her head for a brief moment. “Me, neither.”

blog.description:
I'm Devi and this is my blog for nerding out. Most common atm are NANA & Critical Role. And much more! 
Feel free to send me asks about anything fandom related. I enjoys prompts and questions.  My blog is mostly on queue, except for original posts, so if I seem active and not answering your ask - don't worry, I'll get to you asap.she/her

tags: percival fredrickstein von musel klossowski de rolo iii
summary: I was reading that thing you did on vox Machina fusions and the idea for a Percy/Orthax fusion (which could also explain why...
question: I was reading that thing you did on vox Machina fusions and the idea for a Percy/Orthax fusion (which could also explain why he's so hesitant to fuse with people) popped into my head and i immediately got goosebumps. What's your opinion?
answer:
First off, I gotta say that that post is almost 3 years old!! lol. It was one of my first Critical Role posts!! Oh gosh, it’s so funny to think about now… Quite a few cool people got into it too and posted lots of ideas about it… I think I reblogged them all and stuck them all under the same tag so go ahead and check that out if you’re still into the idea (lol).

ANYWAY, something lots of people got interested in was the idea of Ripley forcibly fusing with Percy as a torture tactic… But Orthax fusing with Percy in this AU is… hm…. That’s just as interesting.

I mean I almost want to say that most of Percy’s time under Orthax contract would have been fusion?  The fusion wouldn’t be visible in that case most of the time.  Most of the time Percy is in complete control - or he thinks he is. But Orthax is always there, a whisper in his head.   At least until Orthax takes control and Percy is just completely out of control - and can’t do anything. In that case, that’s when black smoke emanates and the mask won’t come off of Percy’s face. 

So basically “Darling take the mask off,” but the mask won’t come off, because that isn’t Percy.  Then again maybe I just described possession more than fusion lol.

But maybe Percy had no idea the entire time that he’d been fused with Orthax?  He’d thought everything was all him and that’s another reason he is reluctant to fuse - because he needs complete control of himself. He wants to know where he starts and ends and doesn’t want to worry about what’s himself and what’s coming from someone else in a fusion.
